## Change in Fire 

- Easy and relatively quick method to:
  - Visualize broad fire patterns from the past
  - Visualize expected fire patterns today
  - Swiftly compare and contrast these two standards
  - Draw conclusions about how the role fire has shifted  
  

       
## Change in Fire: The Methods
Assigning "Fire Frequency Groups" 

:::: columns 
::: column 

Historical: 

-  Binning BPS MFRI_all
    -   0-30 Years = Frequent
    -   30-200 Years = Intermediate
    -   200 + Years = Rare
    
:::


::: column
Current:

- Assign groups to EVT
    -   Vegetation type's fire adaptation 
    -   NatureServe Descriptions
    -   Educated Guessing
    
:::
::::

## Results- Historical

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, out.width="70%", fig.align='center'}
library(readr)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(viridis)
library(scales) 

bps_mn <- read_csv("data/BPS_MN.csv")


bps_mn1<-bps_mn%>%
  mutate(Acres = Count*0.2223945)%>% ##Calculate acres
  mutate(Percentage = Acres / sum(Acres) * 100)%>%## percent
  filter(!is.na(SI_FRG))


bps_mn1$SI_FRG <- factor(bps_mn1$SI_FRG, levels = c("Rare","Intermediate","Frequent"))



##give colors to bar
custom_colors <- c("Frequent" = "orange", "Rare" = "skyblue2", "Intermediate" = "darkgreen")

ggplot(bps_mn1, aes(x=Percentage,y=SI_FRG, fill = as.factor(SI_FRG)))+
  geom_bar(stat= "identity")+
  scale_fill_manual(values = custom_colors)+
  labs(title = "Historical Fire Frequency", subtitle = "Percent of Landscape in Each Frequency Group",caption = "Derived From LANDFIRE BpS Data")+
  ylab("")+
  scale_x_continuous(labels = label_comma())+
  theme_bw()+
  theme(legend.position = "none", plot.title = element_text(size=22),
        plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12)) 
  

```

## The change
```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, out.width="70%", fig.align='center'}
##Showing change

##historical fire regime group percentage

bps_mn2<- bps_mn1 %>%    
  mutate(Percentage = Acres / sum(Acres) * 100)  

##current fire regime group percentage

evt_noag1<- evt_noag %>%
  mutate(Percentage = Acres / sum(Acres) * 100) 

## make new df with changing percentages

bps_frgpct<-bps_mn2%>%
  group_by(SI_FRG) %>%
  summarize(hist_percent = sum(Percentage, na.rm = TRUE),)%>%
  rename(Freq = SI_FRG)

evt_frgpct<-evt_noag1%>%
  group_by(Freq) %>%
  summarize(cur_percent = sum(Percentage, na.rm = TRUE),)

frg_chang<-left_join(bps_frgpct,evt_frgpct, by="Freq")

ggplot(frg_chang, aes(
    x = hist_percent, xend = cur_percent, 
    y = Freq,
    color = Freq)) +
  geom_segment(
    arrow = arrow(angle = 30, length = unit(0.5, 'cm')),
    linewidth = 3) +
  labs(
    x = 'Percent', 
    y = element_blank(),
    title = 'Changes in Fire Frequency',
    subtitle = "Minnesota: Historical to ~2023"
  ) +
  scale_color_manual(
    values = custom_colors) +
  theme_bw(base_size = 12) +
  theme(legend.position = "none", plot.title = element_text(size=22),
        plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12)) 
```

## What Happened? and why does this matter?

- Fire Suppression
- Mesophication (forests becoming more moist)
- Ecosystem resiliency
- Biodiversity


## Change in Fire- Summary

- Most of Minnesota used to burn frequently
- Now it doesn't but...
    - The need for frequent fire still exists  
- Able to visualize these trends using this method
